t: John 12
Then*p Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.
There*p they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.
Then*p took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.
Then*p saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, which should betray him,
Why*p was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?
This*p he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.
Then*p said Jesus, Let*r her*r alone:*r against*r the*r day*r of*r my*r burying*r hath*r she*r kept*r this.*r
For*rp the*r poor*r always*r ye*r have*r with*r you;*r but*r me*r ye*r have*r not*r always.*r
Much*p people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus' sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.
But*p the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;
Because*p that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
On*p the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
Took*p branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.
And*p Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,
Fear*p not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.
These*p things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things unto him.
The*p people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.
For*p this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.
The*p Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.
And*p there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:
The*p same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.
Philip*p cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.
And*p Jesus answered them, saying, The*r hour*r is*r come,*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r should*r be*r glorified.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Except*r a*r corn*r of*r wheat*r fall*r into*r the*r ground*r and*r die,*r it*r abideth*r alone:*r but*r if*r it*r die,*r it*r bringeth*r forth*r much*r fruit.*r
He*rp that*r loveth*r his*r life*r shall*r lose*r it;*r and*r he*r that*r hateth*r his*r life*r in*r this*r world*r shall*r keep*r it*r unto*r life*r eternal.*r
If*rp any*r man*r serve*r me,*r let*r him*r follow*r me;*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r there*r shall*r also*r my*r servant*r be:*r if*r any*r man*r serve*r me,*r him*r will*r my*r Father*r honour.*r
Now*rp is*r my*r soul*r troubled;*r and*r what*r shall*r I*r say?*r Father,*r save*r me*r from*r this*r hour:*r but*r for*r this*r cause*r came*r I*r unto*r this*r hour.*r
Father,*rp glorify*r thy*r name.*r Then came there a voice from heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.
The*p people therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.
Jesus*p answered and said, This*r voice*r came*r not*r because*r of*r me,*r but*r for*r your*r sakes.*r
Now*rp is*r the*r judgment*r of*r this*r world:*r now*r shall*r the*r prince*r of*r this*r world*r be*r cast*r out.*r
And*rp I,*r if*r I*r be*r lifted*r up*r from*r the*r earth,*r will*r draw*r all*r men*r unto*r me.*r
This*p he said, signifying what death he should die.
The*p people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The*r Son*r of*r man*r must*r be*r lifted*r up?*r who is this Son of man?

Then*p Jesus said unto them, Yet*r a*r little*r while*r is*r the*r light*r with*r you.*r Walk*r while*r ye*r have*r the*r light,*r lest*r darkness*r come*r upon*r you:*r for*r he*r that*r walketh*r in*r darkness*r knoweth*r not*r whither*r he*r goeth.*r
While*rp ye*r have*r light,*r believe*r in*r the*r light,*r that*r ye*r may*r be*r the*r children*r of*r light.*r These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.
But*p though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:
That*p the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?
Therefore*p they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,
He*p hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.
These*p things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.
Nevertheless*p among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue:
For*p they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
Jesus*p cried and said, He*r that*r believeth*r on*r me,*r believeth*r not*r on*r me,*r but*r on*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r
And*rp he*r that*r seeth*r me*r seeth*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r
I*rp am*r come*r a*r light*r into*r the*r world,*r that*r whosoever*r believeth*r on*r me*r should*r not*r abide*r in*r darkness.*r
And*rp if*r any*r man*r hear*r my*r words,*r and*r believe*r not,*r I*r judge*r him*r not:*r for*r I*r came*r not*r to*r judge*r the*r world,*r but*r to*r save*r the*r world.*r

He*rp that*r rejecteth*r me,*r and*r receiveth*r not*r my*r words,*r hath*r one*r that*r judgeth*r him:*r the*r word*r that*r I*r have*r spoken,*r the*r same*r shall*r judge*r him*r in*r the*r last*r day.*r
For*rp I*r have*r not*r spoken*r of*r myself;*r but*r the*r Father*r which*r sent*r me,*r he*r gave*r me*r a*r commandment,*r what*r I*r should*r say,*r and*r what*r I*r should*r speak.*r
And*rp I*r know*r that*r his*r commandment*r is*r life*r everlasting:*r whatsoever*r I*r speak*r therefore,*r even*r as*r the*r Father*r said*r unto*r me,*r so*r I*r speak.*r
